channel.title: Error starting VM: operation failed: device matching mac address 00:16:3e:5e:6c:
channel.description:
did anyone faced this error message:-
[code]Error starting VM: operation failed: device matching mac address 00:16:3e:5e:6c:0d already exist[/code]
the GW is working good but this error message been popped up inside qubes taskbar (down the screen). also with yellow mark beside the GW in the state.
ignore it or no ? if no , is there a way to fix it ? if no , is it dangerous ?
i think but not sure it is in the category of the "ignore" because from what i have seen inside whonix wiki that whonix doesnt interfere with mac address of the host?! (or maybe the situation here is different i dont know ...)
Edit by Patrick: changed title

item.source: Error starting VM: operation failed: device matching mac address 00:16:3e:5e:6c:

item.title: Error starting VM: operation failed: device matching mac address 00:16:3e:5e:6c:
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/975 says this now should be fixed. Please update your TemplateVMs. And update dom0. Updating from Qubes stable repository is sufficient.

Should this then still not work please put this upstream to https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/975.

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting VM: operation failed: device matching mac address 00:16:3e:5e:6c:

item.title: Error starting VM: operation failed: device matching mac address 00:16:3e:5e:6c:
item.dc:creator: marmarek
item.description:
This seems to be related to this problem:

github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues

Issue: dynamic network attach/detach does not work (kernel oops)

opened by Zrubi on 2015-04-28
closed by marmarek on 2016-05-18 
I have a problem related to live network attach/detach:
The 'default' (if attached before booting the VM) is working, and may be...
C: core C: xen P: critical bug r3.0-dom0-stable r3.0-fc20-stable r3.0-fc21-stable

In short: you’ve probably shut down GW while there were connected AppVMs. Such operation isn’t currently handled properly (the issue linked above). The only thing you can do now, is to shut down those VMs and start them again.

Read full topic
